ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Patient's family objects to drinking
Year Patient's family objects to drinking
Patient thinks they drinks too much
Year Patient thinks they drinks too much
Others (Friends, Doctor, Clergy) said patient is drinking too much
Year Others (Friends, Doctor, Clergy) said patient is drinking too much
Patient feels guilty about their drinking
Year Patient feels guilty about their drinking
Patient lost friends because of drinking
Year Patient lost friends because of drinking
Patient is unable to stop drinking when they wanted to do so
Year Patient is unable to stop drinking when they wanted to do so
Patient tried to control drinking (only allowing drinking at certain times or certain places, such as after 5pm, only on weekends, only with other people))
Year Patient tried to control drinking (only allowing drinking at certain times or certain places, such as after 5pm, only on weekends, only with other people))
Patient needed to drink just after get up (before breakfast)
Year Patient needed to drink just after get up (before breakfast)
Patient substituted nonbeverage forms of alcohol such as rubbing alcohol, mouthwash, or Sterno (jellied, denatured, canned alcohol) when out of liquor
Year Patient substituted nonbeverage forms of alcohol such as rubbing alcohol, mouthwash, or Sterno (jellied, denatured, canned alcohol) when out of liquor
Patient had job troubles because of drinking (drinking on job/missing work)
Year Patient had job troubles because of drinking (drinking on job/missing work)
Patient lost job because of drinking
Year Patient lost job because of drinking
Patient had trouble driving or traffic difficulties because of drinking (accident or DUI)
Year Patient had trouble driving or traffic difficulties because of drinking (accident or DUI)
Patient arrested/held at police station because of drinking/disturbing peace
Year Patient arrested/held at police station because of drinking/disturbing peace
Patient got into fights while drinking
Year Patient got into fights while drinking
Patient neglected responsibilities while on binge/bender (48 hours or more of drinking), must have occurred more than once to be scored as positive
Year Patient neglected responsibilities while on binge/bender (48 hours or more of drinking), must have occurred more than once to be scored as positive
Number of times on bender lasting a couple of days
Patient blacked out while drinking (amnesiac episodes during heavy drinking not accounted for by head trauma)
Year Patient blacked out while drinking (amnesiac episodes during heavy drinking not accounted for by head trauma)
Patient experienced any manifestation of alcohol withdrawal such as shakes/fits/seizures/DTs/see or hearing things that aren't there
Year Patient experienced any manifestation of alcohol withdrawal such as shakes/fits/seizures/DTs/see or hearing things that aren't there
Drinking caused health problems or history of medical complications (cirrhosis, gastritis, pancreatitis, myopathy, polyneuropathy, Wernicke-Korsakoff syndrome, etc.)
Year Drinking caused health problems or history of medical complications (cirrhosis, gastritis, pancreatitis, myopathy, polyneuropathy, Wernicke-Korsakoff syndrome, etc.)
Patient Attended Alcoholics Anonymous (AA) meeting
Year Patient Attended Alcoholics Anonymous (AA) meeting
Question number of symptom which occurred first
Age when first symptom occurred
Met criteria - Feighner alcoholism. A definite diagnosis is made when symptoms occur in at least three of the four groups; a probably diagnosis is made when symptoms occur in only two groups
Notes: 1= Did not meet criteria; 2= Probably met criteria; 3= Definitely met criteria
